lines.text: Positive: Image is real, <u>same</u> side as object
Negative: Image is virtual, <u>opposite</u> side from object

secText:
Lesson:
1. Determine the [OBJ:expsec_t574:signs] for distance and height in mirror equations.
2. [OBJ:expsec_t577:Calculate] focal length using image distance and object distance.
3. Calculate [OBJ:expsec_t579:magnification] using image and object height and distance.
4. Work through a sample problem [OBJ:app_mirror_image_character_question:to calculate focal length] and determine the type of image reflected in a concave mirror.
5. Work through a sample problem to [OBJ:app_mirror_look_for_f_m_question:calculate the focal length and magnification] of a convex mirror.
6. [OBJ:expsec_t575:Calculate] focal length using the radius of curvature in concave and convex mirrors.

In-class assessment:
1. [OBJ:qc_36205:Calculate] object distance using focal length.
2. [OBJ:qc_36188:Calculate] focal length using radius of curvature in a convex mirror.

Quick Review: [OBJ:sum_mirror_lenses_signs:Mirrors and Signs], [OBJ:sum_focal_length:Focal Length Equations], [OBJ:sum_mirror_equations:Mirror Equation], [OBJ:sum_magnification:Magnification Equations]
